conclusion: The figure shows the displacement x as a function of time t.
From 0 s to 4 s the graph of x(t) is a continuously decreasing, smooth curve that goes from +10 m at t = 0 s to –10 m at t = 4 s.

conclusion: Because the slope dx/dt is everywhere negative, the particle always moves in the negative-x direction (never turns back).

conclusion: The particle starts slowly, speeds up steadily, and is fastest near t = 4 s.

conclusion: The equation |dx/dt| = 5 m s⁻¹ has only one solution in the range 0 s < t < 4 s.
